project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
So you have:

Close on the upper right

but then you have to scroll down to get to the update button and then you have to scroll back up to click close  :-(


It would be nice to have and  "update and close" link on the top along with an "update" link too!
fields.summary: Clicking on the ISSUE-# or clicking on the edit icon on an issue brings a window which lacks:  "update and close" and "update"  link

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
So we have one Optional field which can we can set.  But the issue is we often want to show more than just one optional field.  Say 5 :-)

It would be really nice to be able to add multiple fields there.  So in your list view you will have a bit more of an excel spreadsheet type of view of the issues.

I understand that we want to avoid mega crazy spreadsheet view, but having say 5 fields would be really nice :-)
fields.summary: Issue views setup: Needs to have more (say 5) Optional Fields avail

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Howdy,

We are testing GreenHopper and are seeing exceptionally long cloning times for some issues.

When this happens, the JIRA log fills with messages like this:
{noformat}
2009-07-14 09:43:46,964 http-8080-Processor23 WARN [issue.customfields.impl.AbstractSingleFieldType] Repairing ranking for [SRQ-5476]
{noformat}

The symptom seems identical to GHS-1169.

Now, the really odd thing is our SRQ project is NOT in the list of  projects for which GreenHopper is active.

It troubles me that having GreenHopper installed is affecting projects for which GreenHopper is not active.

Is it safe to associate the Ranking field ONLY with projects for which we've enabled GreenHopper?

Will doing so stop this repairing problem?

Thanks,

Jeff.
fields.summary: Repairing ranking when cloning issue in project not using GreenHopper

We use Jira 3.11 and GreenHopper plugin version 3.7.2.
To reproduce this problem, it is necessary to go to some project in Jira and then click on GreenHopper link and then on the "New" link - you will get infinitive gray progress screen and nothing will happen.
I have checked - this problem doesn't appear for 3.5 and 3.6 plugin versions.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
steps:
1. create a context where Closed issues are highlighted and apply to all issue types
2. open the Task Board
3. turn on Outline View
4. close a task
5. close a story

Observed:
the closed task is displayed in the dimmed highlight view but the closed story is not.

Expected:
closed stories should be visibly different from open ones in the Outline view on the Task Board.
fields.summary: Closed stories do no highlight on Task Board in Outline view

From a chat with an existing JIRA customer:

They'd love to have a chart showing number of hours per developer per iteration. Similar to the existing version workload report in JIRA, but with:

fields.description:
When using the Compact View & List View on the Taskboard, the display is not right (i.e. corner field, priority icons,...).  This seems to be related to the resolution.  If it is set to 1024x768 we see this issue, higher resolutions are OK.  Is there anything that can be done about this?  Some people don't like to use the higher resolutions.

Thanks!

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The Master is Armadillo
The first level is Open Suite Webservices,  AB DataGrid, Addams Family and Phoenix

The chart is for Armadillo burndown StoryPoint by children

I would expect each Bar to be the total for the level and the Total Line across the top to be the sum of all the bars.  

Instead it looks like the total is right but the bars are a vurn down of the total and not the burn down for each bar (first level)
fields.summary: Using a 3 level parent child relationship the chart board for the frrst level parent does not display what I would expect

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi,

If the workflow unassigns the issue when it moves to the DONE column and the user has "Assigned to me" ticked then each time the user drags an issue to DONE they see an "Unable to display the issue!" ERROR dialog. This is annoying. For example, one user just complained to me:

{quote}We have quite a big project and so I'm mostly working with the "assigned to me" modus on, it's a bit irritating that I always get the message.
Is this error message planned to be kept like this or will it possible change to a reminder or something?{quote}

I suggest either that the issue be shown but with a red border or something to indicate that it would not normally be shown, or that a less scary / intrusive warning message be displayed somehow, or that the issue appears but then fades away. Better ideas appreciated!

Cheers,

Ximon
fields.summary: Warn the user in a less blocking manner when the transition results in the issue not being displayed

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We are using children versions as sprints to the parent and we cannot just look at the project over view because we have more than one project in the Jira instannce.   If we could report off the parent child relationship we could see how the release is doing similar to the project overview

Tom
fields.summary: As a project manager I would like to be able to report on the parent-child relation ships within the Released charts

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The burn up and burn down charts are nice and I can compute the velocity from that but I would like to be able to look at a bar graph that has the story point velocity achieved in each sprint.  It would be a bonus if you could display what was committed for the sprints and what was achieved and the average velocity.


Then I could apply the average velocity to the number of sprints remaining and determine where the cut line might be using story points instead of hours.

J. C.    Thanks for all your work

Tom
fields.summary: As a project manager I would like a chart that displayed Velocity for the sprint and average velocity for the parent

Originally raised here:

  http://www.greenpeppersoftware.com/site/posts/list/640.page

But I've received no response. I find it very hard to believe that nobody else has a problem with this. The very same problem exists with the GreenPepper Software site so it's not just our instance. I'll attach a screenshot.
fields.summary: Higher contrast active PLANNING BOARD "box" title background colour

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I don't believe this is a bug, rather a mis-understanding on our part as to how the Issue Burndown charts work. You will notice in this project for version 9.1, there are a total of (68) issues, of which (1) is still unresolved. The *Default issue context burndown chart shows us the total number of issues in the Version... the *On the fly burndown only includes the (1) remaining issue that is left to be resolved. Why when we filter and hide all the resolved issues does the burndown only show us the one issue for the entire iteration (version), not the burndown of issues over time?

Please see attached screenshots for more information.
fields.summary: Issue burndown chart confusion

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm not quite sure what's causing this but it's related to the screen used by a transition in some way.

I have a test workflow (which I'll attach in a moment) which has a transition "Resolved" from "In Progress" to "Resolved" which uses a screen which has ONLY a resolution field. 

The workflow also has a "Resolved" -> "Closed" transition which uses a screen which has fix version, assignee and resolution.

The TASK BOARD has been configured to have a fourth column (in the 3rd position) called "RESOLVED" which shows issues in any resolution with status "Resolved".

The workflow has no problems when moved through via standard JIRA workflow action links.

If I drag on the TASK BOARD from "IN PROGRESS" to "RESOLVED" (column 2 to column 3) I see the attached popup asking me to pick a fix resolution (which works fine).

If I drag on the TASK BOARD from "RESOLVED" to "DONE" (column 3 to column 4) I see the 2nd attached popup but on pressing "DONE" I then see the 3rd attached popup and pressing the "Done" top right link causes a JIRA exception and the dialog reappears:

fields.description:
Burndown charts don't do a good job of showing when scope gets added to a project. There are q number of good charting techniques for doing this. See possible examples in fugs 3-23 to 3-26 here:

http://alistair.cockburn.us/Earned-value+and+burn+charts

Either add a vertical spike when new stories are added or old stories are re-estimated -- or convey the same thing by having the bottom line step down below zero (This is nice because you can get a sense of the total scope addition over time).
fields.summary: As a project manager, I would like to be able to view a burndown chart that clearly communicates changes in scope.

Cheers,

fields.description:
We were able to create this error with the following configuration:

Administration -> Custom Fields -> Ranking = "Stories"
Greenhopper -> Configuration -> Ranking fields.  Ensure Ranking is enabled.

Greenhopper -> Planning Board -> Context "On the fly"
No filters
Sort by ranking

Click "new card" ->  "Bug" -> Click "Ranking" pencil -> Cancel
Enter a summary
Click "Create"

*"System Error: Method > invoked ::: customfield_10020"*

Once this issue was created it continued to happen.

We were able to *resolve* the issue by changing:
Administration -> Custom Fields -> Ranking to "Any Issue Type"

Is there any situation where you would not want to rank an issue??

Thanks,
Jon Sword

fields.description:
Currently when using the Planning Board to assign issues, all users that have the assign-to permission appear. If the number is larger than 75 users, this feature is switched off.

In many organizations engineers "can work" in most projects, although they are "likely to work" in just one, maybe two. Therefore for any project the number of users with the assign-to permissions will be large. However the number of user which are "likely candidates" for the assignment will be far smaller. If it was possible to specify an additional user group (I.e. the "project team") to filter the assignable users in the Assignee Board, then this problem would be resolved.

See GHS-1246 for some background discussion.

fields.description:
{{As a GH User, I would like to be able to split a story and select which sub-tasks to re-parent}}
Original issue raised for (Classic) GreenHopper.

--

This is different than cloning in that we want to clone the issue and re-parent sub-tasks not copy them.  Maybe Atlassian could put this in their core product but -GH- the Agile boards are primarily where it would be used.

Acceptance criteria:
# Should have a way to split an issue from either the -Planning or Task Boards- Backlog or Active sprints/Kanban board. Could be on the card drop-down menu.
# Should clone parent issue without sub-tasks.
# Should allow selection of 0 or many sub-tasks to re-parent to the new issue.
fields.summary: Ability to split a story and select which sub-tasks to re-parent

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
One of the most useful features of GreenPepper is the ability to edit issues by dragging and dropping. For example, the "Planning Board" is a life saver when scheduling hundreds of issues - just drag & drop them to the associated version.

Once issues are scheduled, the next step in many organizations is to assign issues to developers. The only way to do so with JIRA is edit each issue or use bulk edit - but this is very inefficient. I would like to have a similar abilitty to the "Planning Board" - I'd like to drag issues into developers to get them assigned to them.
fields.summary: Assign Board

fields.description:
When you have a ticket in the current sprint and release, and you add a subsequent sprint (iteration) to the ticket on the Edit screen of the ticket, the additional iteration's release is not automatically detected and added. Using the sync link also does not make it pick up.

I'm sure this is low priority since you manually have to edit the ticket (instead of drag and drop) to get two to show up in the first place, plus we shouldn't have rollover. We encountered this during our last sprint, when we were planning, so we didn't want to take it out of the current sprint, but wanted to account for it in the upcoming sprint.
fields.summary: Second release doesn't get added automatically to fix versions

fields.description:
I would like a generate chart button rather than having the chart generate everytime that I select something.    Generation of the chart is time consuming and having it generate several times before I can get all items set makes it more frustrating.


Also when I select chart board I would like to navigate to the chart board and give me a chance to set parameters before generating the chart.   I am in a situation right now, where the chart has several hundred issues and it takes minutes (more thant 20) to generate.  I would like to change that but I have to wait for it to finish before I can change it.
fields.summary: As a project manager I would like the ability to edit chart board seetings  without having the charts generated each time in order to save time when crating and managing contexts.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
1. create a story with more than 12 subtasks
2. in the Planning Board, drag the story to a new version

Observed:
The Update Version popup is broken. None of the cards show for the subtasks on either page. Once you click Update, none of the subtasks are moved, even if you make sure to click the Select All option. 

Expected:
Dragging a story with more than 12 subtasks should work the same as one with fewer subtasks.
fields.summary: Dragging a story with more than 12 subtasks to a new version in the Planning Board fails

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I thought we had this nailed, but have upgraded to GH 3.3 on Jira 3.10 and it is still occurring. 

Users using IE6 cannot look at cards in list view on the task board. They can use the card view to get around it, but this is not ideal.

Also, quite often the task board and/or the planning board will hang in IE6 (regardless of the view type) with the IEXPLORE.EXE CPU utilization in the Task Manaager exceeding 50%. Only way to fix is to close IE via Task Manager.

All works fine in Firefox 3.x, but unfortunately corporate SOE users are stuck with IE6 currently.

Can supply more documentation if required.
fields.summary: Task Board Hangs/Displays Incorrectly in IE6

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. In JIRA, create a filter based on a custom field available only to specific issue types
2. Saved the filter
3. In GreenHopper, create a context based on the filter you created
4. Select the context you just created
5. Go back to JIRA and view the results of the filter

Observed:
The issues displayed in the context do not match the issues in the filter results. 

Expected:
Context and filter results should match when based on JIRA filters.
fields.summary: Contexts based on Saved Filters using custom fields that apply to specific issue types do not work

fields.description:
Unable to display the issue!  Dialog box  needs to show the issue(s)  URL that are no longer displaying

So you do something and get this message  (e.g. filter being show non resolved issues.  Then you resolve and issue by accident!   Now you get this dialog that doesn't have any useful info in it really. 

The dialog should at least show the issue IDis trying to display (the JRA-5764 or what not).

If that info is lost, then this dialog is pretty superfluous.


ERROR!                                           OK

Unable to display the issue!

• Your filter hides the issue.
To view it, you have to adjust your filter settings.
fields.summary: Unable to display the issue!  Dialog box  needs to show the issue(s)  URL that are no longer displaying

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
when triaging (resolving / force closing issues) I often get the message box:  "Unable to display the issue!" forcing me to click it closed


ERROR!                                           OK

Unable to display the issue!

• Your filter hides the issue.
To view it, you have to adjust your filter settings.


I have a filter that is:  NonResolvedIssues.  Which shows me all of the issues that are not resolved.  So I am going through all of those issues and looking to see if they need to be moved to a different sprint or if in fact they have been resolved.

When I resolve something I get that Dialog forcing me to have to click "OK".    

I would like a way to choose to not have that dialog display.  

I just did an action and now an issue is no longer valid.    Sounds good.
fields.summary: when triaging (resolving / force closing issues) I often get the message box:  "Unable to display the issue!" forcing me to click it closed
